definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to continue/to proceed with/to go on with
to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
Sun Jihai (1977-), Chinese footballer, played for Manchester City (2002-2008)
to succeed sb in a job/successor
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages

sentences.english: Mr. Smith was succeeded by Mrs. Jones as treasurer.
sentences.chinese: 瓊斯夫人繼史密斯先生任會計。

sentences.english: This is a Greek word that simply means the successors.
sentences.chinese: 這是個希臘語，意思就是繼業者。

sentences.english: After security, food and water make up the second link of the chain.
sentences.chinese: 繼安全之後，糧食與水構成生存之鏈的第二環。

sentences.english: After the Persians it was Alexander the Great's turn.
sentences.chinese: 繼波斯帝國之後，阿富汗的統治者是亞歷山大大帝。

sentences.english: So, in lieu of books, the new trend seems to be banning fat.
sentences.chinese: 於是，繼禁書之後，新的趨勢似乎是要禁脂肪。

sentences.english: Lovebirds Justin Bieber and Selena Gomez may be planning a duet.
sentences.chinese: 繼情侶賈斯汀畢伯，戈麥斯可能策劃二重唱。

sentences.english: Guocheng was a famous Yunnan monk painter in the Qing Dynasty after the painter Dandang.
sentences.chinese: 果成是清代繼擔當之後的另一位著名的雲南畫僧。

sentences.english: Paksey Bridge is the second largest bridge project next to Jamuna Bridge in Bangladesh.
sentences.chinese: 帕克西橋是孟加拉國繼賈木納橋後的第二大橋樑工程。
繼伍德斯托克音樂節之後，多個大型集會登場。
我突然有了一個繼兄弟。

sentences.english: Following Chen Ziang, He Zhizhang is the only one who take the responsibility of the reformation of poem style.
sentences.chinese: 繼陳子昂之後，他是自覺地承擔起詩風改革的又一人。

sentences.english: It was a major success for the studio, after the failure of Sleeping Beauty which lost the studio a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 這是工作室繼《睡美人》虧損之後一個重大的創舉。

sentences.english: And she has met her step-grandson only a few times.
sentences.chinese: 她和她的“繼孫子”也只見過幾次面。

sentences.english: Subsequent to indictments and arrests, the examining magistrate deals with the individual cases.
sentences.chinese: 繼起訴和逮捕之後，預審法官開始處理個案。

sentences.english: Cancer is the second-leading cause of death in the United States after heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 癌症是美國繼心臟病之後的第二大死因。

sentences.english: A generation after Copernicus, Galileo (1564-1642) proved that Copernicus was right.
sentences.chinese: 繼哥白尼之後，伽利略證明哥白尼是對的。

definition: (conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to continue/to proceed with/to go on with
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
for this reason/with regards to this/in this respect/in order to do this/to this end
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
